components.description: A latin cross, otherwise known as a Christian cross. This cross symbol is often used as a symbol of Christianity. Similar in appearance to the Orthodox cross.
components.title: Latin Cross

description: A latin cross, otherwise known as a Christian cross. This cross symbol is often used as a symbol of Christianity. Similar in appearance to the Orthodox cross.
title: Latin Cross

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: A latin cross, otherwise known as a Christian cross. This cross symbol is often used as a symbol of Christianity. Similar in appearance to t http://emojipedia.org/latin-cross/
emoji_net_data.name: latin cross

bn:00099655a: Relating to or characteristic of Christianity
Of, like or relating to Christianity or Christians.

bn:00099656a: Professing the religion that originated in the teachings of Jesus of Nazareth, called Jesus Christ. That belongs to or is characteristic of Christianity.
Of, like or relating to Jesus Christ.
Following the teachings or manifesting the qualities or spirit of Jesus Christ

bn:00018818n: A religious person who believes Jesus is the Christ and who is a member of a Christian denomination
A Christian is a person who adheres to Christianity, an Abrahamic, monotheistic religion based on the life and teachings of Jesus of Nazareth.
Based on the Greek letter Chi used by early Christians
A religious person who believes Jesus is the Christ and who is a member of a Christian denomination.

bn:00032770n: "Grilled Cheesus" is the third episode of the second season of the American television series Glee, and the 25th episode overall.
A religion in which rules exist to govern the means by which adherents participate in the religion.
An institution to express belief in a divine power
An institution to express belief in a divine power.
Organized religion, also known as institutional religion, is religion as a social institution, in which belief systems and rituals are systematically arranged and formally established.

bn:02109827n: The Christian Cross, seen as a representation of the instrument of the crucifixion of Jesus, is the best-known symbol of Christianity.

bn:00018828n: Monotheistic religion founded in the first century
"Spiritual Friendship" is a text from the 12th century by Cistercian monk Saint Aelred of Rievaulx.
An Abrahamic religion based on the teachings of Jesus Christ and various scholars who wrote the Christian Bible.
Christianity is an Abrahamic, monotheistic religion based on the life and oral teachings of Jesus of Nazareth as presented in the New Testament.
Christianity is an Abrahamic religion, its adherents are known as Christians.
A monotheistic religion centered on the life and teachings of Jesus of Nazareth as depicted in the New Testament.
A monotheistic system of beliefs and practices based on the Old Testament and the teachings of Jesus as embodied in the New Testament and emphasizing the role of Jesus as savior
